intro: Vernonia lafukensis, commonly known as the Kauaʻi vernonia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Vernonia lafukensis is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting its ecological significance in Hawaii's unique flora.
